page.title: 17HISTORIC SITES IN MIDDLETON
page.content:
{ St.LEONARD'S PARISH CHURCH:}Most of the building was erected in the 15th and 16th Centuries but a church has stood on the site for 800 years. There is a stained glass window commemorating the Battle of Flodden. There is also an unusual wooden belfry.
{HOPWOOD HALL, ALKRINGTON HALL & {TONGE HALL}were homes of important local families.{ { {THE OLDE BOAR'S HEAD INN}is a black & white timber building dating from Tudor times. It was a farm before it was turned into a public house. { {THE OLD GRAMMAR SCHOOL}erected in 1586, is a fine example of a Tudor school building, but is now semi- derelict.
